title: What now for five losing teams from wild-card weekend? Barnwell on each front office's next steps
content: Potential offensive changes for the Eagles? Retooling needed for the Packers? Let's size up why five playoff teams are heading home early.

title: Sources: Packers will try to keep LaFleur as HC
content: The Packers are expected to try to work out a deal in the coming days to keep head coach Matt LaFleur in Green Bay, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: 49ers lose Kittle but carry his 'energy' to win
content: Despite another devastating injury to a team captain, the 49ers embodied the spirit of George Kittle to help will themselves to a playoff win over the Eagles.

title: Maye 'didn't throw very well,' pins win on defense
content: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye wasn't thrilled with his performance in Sunday's 16-3 wild-card victory over the Chargers. "Wasn't pretty, that's for sure," he said.

title: Sirianni defends Brown after drops, sideline spat
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni defended wide receiver A.J. Brown after a pair of drops in Sunday's loss to the Niners and also downplayed an animated interaction the two had in the opening half.

title: Herbert takes blame for Chargers' latest ouster
content: The Los Angeles Chargers' season ended Sunday with a loss to the New England Patriots, and Justin Herbert took responsibility for the poor performance, telling reporters after the 16-3 defeat, "I didn't play well enough and didn't make any plays."

title: QB Chambliss' eligibility fight heads to state court
content: Lawyers for Trinidad Chambliss plan to file suit against the NCAA in Mississippi state court this week for a preliminary injunction that will aim to secure the quarterback's eligibility for 2026.

title: Ant sinks winner to cap wild Wolves rally vs. Spurs
content: Anthony Edwards put the finishing touches on a wild, comeback win for Minnesota over San Antonio, a game they opened by trailing 16-0.

title: Irish deny battery allegation against Freeman
content: Notre Dame has denied that Marcus Freeman made physical contact with anyone after the football coach was accused of battery in a police report filed Jan. 3.

title: üëÄ Offseason guide for all eliminated NFL teams
content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 20 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: Steelers aren't sweating playoff drought: 'We came here for what lies ahead'
content: As Pittsburgh aims to end playoff futility, how's the team approaching Monday's game (8:15 p.m. ET, ABC/ESPN)?

title: Texas-sized turnaround has Houston rolling into playoffs
content: Two key wins and a sideline scuffle highlight a run to the playoffs that happened despite an 0-3 start.

title: Four first-round picks for a star?! It's risky. Lessons from the past 14 blockbuster trades
content: As teams shy away from dealing first-rounders for stars, which trades have been the biggest successes and utter failures?

title: Party like '99? Three reasons for -- and three against -- New York winning the East
content: Nearly halfway through the season, do the Knicks look any closer to reaching the Finals for the first time in 26 years?

title: What comes next after a wild week in the hockey world?
content: From trade chatter in multiple cities to epic blowouts to a hole in the Olympic ice, hockey fans have lots to digest.

title: JuJu Watkins makes history as Sierra Canyon's first jersey retirement
content: The USC standout became the first athlete in Sierra Canyon's history to receive the honor after a decorated three-year run.

title: From Wrexham to Macclesfield, FA Cup reminded us why we love soccer
content: Thanks to Macclesfield causing one of the biggest upsets ever and Wrexham passing their Premier League test, the FA Cup third round really delivered.

title: Supreme Court transgender athlete cases FAQ: What to expect
content: The national debate over transgender athlete participation will be heard by the U.S. Supreme Court. Here's what you need to know.

title: 'Hungry for more': 49ers' petty posts at Eagles tops NFL wild-card trolls
content: The NFL wild-card round had its fair share of petty posts after big wins, led by the San Francisco 49ers.

title: WNBA, WNBPA fail to reach new CBA at deadline
content: The WNBA and its players' union failed to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement or an extension of the previous one by Friday's 11:59 p.m. ET deadline.

title: Project-75I: How India‚Äôs Rs 72,000 cr submarine upgrade reshapes the Pakistan, China equation
content: India's Project-75I, acquiring six advanced German Type-214NG submarines, is gaining urgency amid regional tensions and China's growing undersea presence. This crucial naval procurement emphasises indigenous construction, technology transfer, and bolstering India's deterrence capabilities in the Indian Ocean.

title: The Delta Force gap: Why China can't do a Maduro-type op ‚Äî for now
content: US precision in Venezuela operation sparks debate on China's capabilities. Analysts highlight US advantage in integrated, all-domain operations, a fusion China lacks due to fragmented special forces and political control. While China boasts modern weaponry, replicating swift, surgical strikes against Taiwan remains a distant prospect, suggesting any attempt would be far more destructive.

title: Gurgaon: Coach 'rapes' minor at stadium bathroom; pregnancy led to complaint
content: A junior hockey coach in Gurgaon has been arrested. He is accused of raping a minor student four months ago. The student, a Class 12 player, reported the incident after becoming pregnant. She suffered a miscarriage. The coach is in police custody for questioning. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Kattuppadu trumps Koottani? NDA under stress in Tamil Nadu; EPS draws red line
content: For Tamil Nadu‚Äôs political culture, shaped by decades of Dravidian assertion and a strong emphasis on regional autonomy, such an explicit pre-election claim has few precedents. The reaction within the AIADMK has been wary, if not outright resistant, as the BJP‚Äôs clout in the South remains lean. The pre-poll power-sharing deal, however, is only one strand in a much larger and more byzantine political development.

title: Apple's Korea hotel gambit failing: Memory costs jump 300%; chipmakers refuse long-term deals
content: Apple executives are in South Korea negotiating memory chip deals amidst soaring prices, up to 300% since mid-2025.  Memory makers are planning aggressive hikes, even charging Samsung's own divisions significantly more.  This AI-driven shortage means less RAM for phones and PCs, with Apple facing tough renegotiations this month.

title: How Rubio's childhood shaped Trump's Venezuela policy
content: Marco Rubio grew up inside that world. His political formation was not shaped by textbooks or diplomatic theory but by stories of a lost homeland, a stolen future and a US that, in exile memory, had failed to finish the job in 1961. Cuba was not history. It was a wound.

title: 'You can't align what you can't control': Microsoft AI boss warns rivals
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges the industry to prioritize containment over alignment in AI development, warning against pursuing superintelligence without first ensuring control. He advocates for a "Humanist Superintelligence" approach, focusing on practical applications like medical AI and clean energy, to maintain human oversight and avoid uncontrolled autonomous systems.

title: 'Won't go to any version of me that didn't know you': Anushka's post goes viral
content: As Vamika turned three on January 11, Anushka shared a post on Instagram and wrote a note about motherhood and how it has changed her life. She said she would not want to return to a time before becoming a parent.

title: 'No nation more essential...': Gor says next call on India-US deal tomorrow; tariffs in focus
content: India-US trade deal: US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor said trade deal talks are ongoing, with both sides actively engaged and the next discussion scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Wealth tax: Another billionaire plans to leave California; calls proposal stupid
content: California is seeing wealthy tech leaders depart. DoorDash co-founder Andy Fang announced his exit, citing the state's new Wealth Tax. This tax targets founders with supervoting shares, potentially increasing their taxable ownership. Sergey Brin and Larry Page of Google also relocated. The law's wording is criticized as a trap for tech innovators.

title: 'Like Dhoni': Ex-India cricketer lauds finisher Rahul's single taking ability
content: KL Rahul showcased remarkable composure and adaptability in India's tense four-wicket victory over New Zealand. He expertly navigated a challenging chase, prioritizing strike rotation and protecting his partners before unleashing his finishing skills in the final overs. Chopra lauded Rahul's maturity and game awareness, comparing his calm demeanor to MS Dhoni's.

title: Happy Lohri 2026: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share
content: Lohri, North India's vibrant harvest festival, celebrates the end of winter and the sun's return to longer days. Primarily observed by Punjabis, Sikhs, and Hindus, it's a thanksgiving for rabi crops, marked by bonfires, traditional songs, and festive foods. In 2026, Lohri falls on January 13th, ushering in a period of joy and new beginnings.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle confirms delay in Sports Club Atelier collection
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, shared an update on her upcoming collaboration with Hockey Canada, confirming a slight delay in the launch. She emphasized the importance of getting every detail right. The collection follows the success of her earlier releases, which blend hockey culture with luxury streetwear.

title: Vanessa Bryant thanks fans for braving rain at emotional Mamba book signing
content: Vanessa Bryant recently hosted a 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever' book signing, drawing large crowds despite rain. The event celebrated Kobe and Gianna Bryant's enduring legacy through art and community. Fans shared personal stories, highlighting how Vanessa's foundation continues to inspire and provide sports opportunities for underserved youth, honoring her family's memory.

title: Ayesha Curry promotes Jamaican tourism after devastating hurricane
content: Ayesha Curry is urging fans to support Jamaica's recovery from Hurricane Melissa by visiting the island. She highlighted that tourism is crucial for the Jamaican economy, with nearly 30% of the workforce dependent on it. Curry emphasized that a vacation serves as a donation, with airports and most hotels now operational.

title: 'Seize and hold the cities': 5 takeaways from Reza Pahlavi's declaration amid Iran protests
content: Pahlavi does not present himself merely as a supporter of the street movement. He explicitly says that the scale of the demonstrations has given him the authority to act. ‚ÄúWith the legitimacy and acceptance I have received from you,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúI declare another phase of the national uprising to overthrow the Islamic Republic and reclaim our beloved Iran.‚Äù

title: Dhankhar hospitalised: Ex-VP admitted to AIIMS, to undergo MRI; fainted twice last week
content: Former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar was admitted to AIIMS on Monday. He experienced two episodes of unconsciousness last week. Doctors at AIIMS insisted on his admission for further tests. Dhankhar had previously fainted on several occasions while serving as Vice President. He resigned from his post in July citing health reasons.

title: Big Bash: Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan gets retired out after slow knock - watch
content: Mohammad Rizwan became the first overseas player in the BBL to be retired out after struggling to accelerate the scoring for Melbourne Renegades.  He managed 26 runs off 23 balls, and his departure did little to boost the team's momentum, as they finished on 170/8. Rizwan's BBL campaign has been below expectations with 167 runs in eight matches.

title: From Maharashtra to TN, has 'women first' become best poll bet for parties?
content: Political parties are increasingly targeting women voters, seen as kingmakers in elections. Ahead of Maharashtra's civic polls, the state government scheduled welfare payouts just before voting, drawing criticism from the Congress. Similarly, Tamil Nadu's DMK government expanded its women's welfare scheme and announced additional payments, also facing accusations of electoral timing.

title: 'Is Virat Kohli arrogant?' Ajinkya Rahane gives a candid answer ‚Äì watch
content: Ajinkya Rahane offers a unique insight into Virat Kohli's mindset, revealing his greatness stems from a misunderstood 'attitude of learning and never giving up.' Rahane explains Kohli's pre-match withdrawal isn't arrogance but a method to enter his zone. Kohli's relentless work ethic and drive for improvement continue to define his record-breaking career.

title: 'Will come to Mumbai, try cutting my legs': Annamalai fires back at Raj Thackeray; slams ‚Äòrasmalai‚Äô jab
content: BJP leader K Annamalai dared MNS chief Raj Thackeray to stop him from entering Mumbai after receiving threats, including those of physical harm. Thackeray had earlier mocked Annamalai and questioned his connection to Mumbai, while also vowing to expel Bihari and UP migrants imposing Hindi.

title: Luke Littler net worth: Tournament winnings, endorsements, and earnings
content: Teenage darts sensation Luke Littler has rapidly risen on the PDC circuit, winning major titles and earning over ¬£2 million in prize money. Backed by lucrative sponsorships, media work, and global brand deals, Littler has become one of the most marketable and financially successful young stars in professional darts.

title: '40 balls daily daalne hain, batting ke baad': How Ayush Badoni earned maiden India call-up
content: Ayush Badoni received a maiden India call-up for the remaining ODIs against New Zealand, replacing an injured Washington Sundar. His coach highlighted Badoni's dedication to improving his off-spin bowling, a skill he developed through rigorous practice. Badoni's all-round abilities and leadership experience also contributed to his selection.

title: Shikhar Dhawan announces engagement to Sophie: Are they getting married in February 2026?
content: Shikhar Dhawan announced his engagement to Irish girlfriend Sophie Shine on January 12th, sharing a picture with his ladylove. The couple, who confirmed their relationship in May 2025, met in Dubai and have been living together for over a year. They are reportedly set to marry in February 2026.

title: 'Have to maintain decorum': Om Birla slams Kirti Azad for vaping inside Parliament; adds 'action soon'
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla announced disciplinary action against TMC MP Kirti Azad for allegedly vaping in the House. Birla emphasized maintaining parliamentary decorum, stating that violations will be punished under established rules.

title: You should always photograph your hotel room when you arrive; here‚Äôs the reason
content: When checking into a hotel, travelers are advised to take photos and videos of the room immediately. This documentation, focusing on early timestamps rather than quality, serves as crucial evidence to prevent disputes over damages or missing items later.  These raw, unedited files, saved and backed up, provide a clear record of the room's condition before your stay.

title: 'It's not a great feeling': Virat Kohli speaks out on crowd cheers after teammate's wicket
content: India's master batter Virat Kohli expressed discomfort with fans cheering his arrival at the crease upon a batter's dismissal, a practice he finds disheartening for the departing player. Despite this, Kohli remains grateful for fan support and focused on team victory, as demonstrated by his match-winning 93 in India's chase.

title: Sara Arjun on her debut Telugu film: 'Signed Gunashekar's 'Euphoria' before 'Dhurandhar'
content: Child actor turned Bollywood actress Sara Arjun, who debuted at 18 months, discusses her impactful roles in 'Euphoria' and 'Dhurandhar'.  She prioritizes challenging characters and strong narratives, feeling these films address crucial societal issues relevant to today's youth.  Her dedication to acting continues despite initial study plans.

title: ‚ÄòTop attack capability against moving target‚Äô: DRDO tests anti-tank guided missile ‚Äî watch
content: DRDO successfully flight tested its third-generation Man Portable Anti-Tank Guided Missile (MPATGM) with top-attack capability. The shoulder-launched missile, weighing approximately 14.5 kg, demonstrated a precise strike on a moving target's upper surface during trials in Maharashtra. This indigenously developed system features advanced technologies for effective tank and armored vehicle neutralization.

title: Marinera crisis: Merchant navy officer caught up in seizure of Russian tanker; kin seek PM's help
content: Rakshit Chauhan, a 26‚Äëyear‚Äëold merchant navy officer from Palampur in Himachal Pradesh‚Äôs Kangra district, is among three Indian nationals detained after a Russian‚Äëflagged oil tanker was seized by the United States in the North Atlantic on January 7. Rakshit, on his first sea assignment with a Russian employer and posted to the Marinera tanker bound for Venezuela, was stopped at sea after the US Coast Guard intercepted the vessel amid broader sanctions enforcement.

title: Sam Kerr & Kristie Mewis net worth: Football earnings, deals and life together
content: Sam Kerr and Kristie Mewis are one of football‚Äôs most loved couples. Their combined net worth is around $10‚Äì$12 million. They met through football, went public in 2021, got engaged in 2023, and married in December 2025. In 2025, they welcomed their son, Jagger. Today, they balance football and family life.

title: MC Mary Kom addresses affair rumours amid divorce from Onler Kom
content: Legendary boxer MC Mary Kom has revealed shocking details about her divorce from Onler Kom after nearly 20 years of marriage. She alleged financial betrayal, claiming her ex-husband lived off her earnings and withdrew a significant sum from her account without permission. Mary also addressed affair allegations, stating her business manager entered her life post-divorce.

title: Rare moment for gulf skies: International Space Station visible over Qatar for 6 minutes
content: Skywatchers in Qatar witnessed the International Space Station (ISS) streak across the evening sky on January 11, 2026. Visible to the naked eye for about six minutes after sunset, the fast-moving, bright light captivated observers and sparked widespread sharing on social media, offering a tangible connection to human achievement in space.

title: IND vs NZ: Ayush Badoni earns maiden ODI call-up as Washington Sundar ruled out of series
content: India's ODI series against New Zealand faces disruption as Washington Sundar is ruled out due to a rib injury sustained in the first match. Young batter Ayush Badoni earns his maiden national call-up as his replacement. This setback follows Rishabh Pant's earlier withdrawal, highlighting ongoing injury concerns for the Indian squad.

title: How Cholesterol can power tomorrow's devices
content: Indian researchers have discovered that cholesterol, a waxy molecule, can control electron spin, a property crucial for future spintronic devices. By incorporating metal ions into cholesterol-based structures, scientists can tune the spin preference of electrons, paving the way for more efficient and sustainable electronics.

title: India-Germany trade: PM Modi, German chancellor Merz meet CEOs; aim to boost economic ties
content: Prime Minister Modi and German Chancellor Merz met in Ahmedabad, highlighting robust economic and strategic ties. Bilateral trade has surpassed $50 billion, with over 2,000 German companies operating in India. The leaders also agreed to establish an India-Germany Centre of Excellence to boost technology and clean energy collaboration.

title: IND vs NZ: Chase Kings! India first team to hunt down 300-plus targets 20 times in ODIs
content: India achieved a historic four-wicket victory over New Zealand in the first ODI, successfully chasing down a target of 301. This win marked their 20th successful pursuit of 300-plus totals in ODIs, a world record. Virat Kohli's 93 anchored the chase, with crucial late contributions from Harshit Rana and KL Rahul sealing the win.

title: Eagles fans face renewed scrutiny as Wild Card incidents revive 'worst fans' label
content: Eagles fans faced national scrutiny during their Wild Card game against the 49ers on January 11, 2026, after allegations of throwing beer cans at opposing supporters. This incident followed a Philadelphia sports bar's viral refusal to host 49ers fans, reigniting debates about fan behavior and the line between passion and perception.

title: I-PAC raids: ED makes big charge against Mamata in SC; accuses CM of destroying evidence
content: The Enforcement Directorate has approached the Supreme Court. It seeks an FIR against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, the DGP, and the Kolkata Police Commissioner. The agency alleges obstruction and evidence tampering in a money laundering case. This involves a probe into the political consultancy firm I-PAC. The ED claims its officers were threatened and evidence was seized.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO day 39 Vs 'The Raja Saab' day 4: The Ranveer Singh film crosses Rs 800cr
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its strong run into its sixth weekend, outperforming 'The Raja Saab' in the Hindi belt. Despite a slight dip on Friday due to the new release, 'Dhurandhar's' weekend collections remain impressive. The film is projected to finish significantly ahead of 'Pushpa 2' in net collections, with a notable surprise in Mysore/Karnataka.

title: TVK Not Responsible, Vijay Told CBI In Questioning Over Karur Stampede: Sources
content: After nearly six hours of questioning by the Central Bureau of Investigation in Delhi, TVK chief Vijay on Monday told the premier agency that his party is not responsible for the stampede in Tamil Nadu that claimed 41 lives, sources have told NDTV.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar Admitted To AIIMS After He Faints At Home Twice
content: Former vice president Jagdeep Dhankhar was admitted to the All-India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) after he fell unconscious twice on January 10, his office said.

title: Once A Maoist Corridor, Kanha Reserve To Host Wild Buffaloes After 100 Years
content: A forest route once whispered about as a safe passage for armed Maoist cadres in eastern Madhya Pradesh is now being recast as a gateway for wildlife revival.

title: Andhra Chief Minister Hails Highway Authority For 4 Guinness World Records
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu applauded the NHAI for achieving four Guinness World Records on the Bengaluru-Kadapa-Vijayawada Economic Corridor in the state.

title: Who Is Sergio Gor, US Ambassador Pushing India-US Trade Talks
content: Sergio Gor, also the Special Envoy to South and Central Asia, said US President Donald Trump may visit India by next year.

title: Raghav Chadha Turns Blinkit Rider Amid Row Over Gig Workers' Demands
content: Rajya Sabha MP and Aam Aadmi Party leader Raghav Chadha turned into a delivery rider, as he chose to step "away from boardrooms".

title: UAE Blocks Students From UK Universities Over Radicalisation Fears: Report
content: UAE, which provides its high-achieving students generous grants to study abroad, has been restricting admissions to British universities over fears that campuses are being radicalised by an extremist Islamist group, a UK media report said.

title: "Disgusting": Supreme Court On Judicial Officer Found Urinating In Train Coach
content: The Supreme Court on Monday said that it was disgusted by the alleged misconduct of a civil judge from Madhya Pradesh during a train journey, including allegations of urinating in the train compartment.

title: Supreme Court Sets June 30 Deadline For Bengaluru Civic Body Polls
content: The Supreme Court on Monday set June 30 as the date for the completion of the election process of Bengaluru civic body Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP).

title: Defence Sourcing Not Driven By Ideology, Says India On Germany's 'Offer'
content: India's policy of choosing from where to source defence hardware is driven by national interest, and is not at all ideological, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri said in response to a question by NDTV.

title: IndiGo Flight Makes Emergency Landing In Varanasi After Bird Hit
content: A Bengaluru-bound IndiGo Airlines flight with 216 passengers on board made an emergency landing at the Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport here following a bird strike, airport officials said Monday.

title: 'Their Place In Jail': D Fadnavis Hits Out At Parties Giving Poll Tickets To Criminals
content: Devendra Fadnavis has strongly criticised political parties for fielding candidates with criminal backgrounds in Pune civic polls, questioning the contradiction between promises of crime-free governance and the reality of ticket distribution.

title: "Leader Of Partying, Tourism": BJP Jeers As Rahul Gandhi Visits Vietnam
content: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's ongoing visit to Vietnam has drawn the usual barbs from the BJP, with the ruling party reiterating that he is not the "Leader of the Opposition" but a "Leader of partying and tourism".

title: 'Misogyny': Karnataka Congress Lawmaker Amid Online Abuse Over 'Western' Dressing
content: Karnataka Congress MLA Nayana spoke out against the online abuse she has been facing over her choice of clothing, calling it a reflection of deep-rooted misogyny faced by women in politics.

title: Will Raj Thackeray Tie-Up Dent Uddhav Thackeray's Moderate Image? His Reply
content: The BJP should show one election in which they did not raise the Hindu-Muslim issue, Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray told NDTV in an exclusive interview with NDTV days ahead of the high-voltage election to the BMC polls

title: "Try Chopping Off Legs": K Annamalai Dares Raj Thackeray Amid "Rasmalai" Row
content: K Annamalai, whom the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief had recently dubbed "Rasmalai (a delectable sweet dish)", thereby sparking a massive row, hit back today with a dare.

title: Genius Chimpanzee 'Ai' Who Could Paint, Count Dies In Japan At 49
content: Ai, a "genius" chimpanzee who could recognise more than 100 Chinese characters and the English alphabet, has died aged 49, Japanese researchers said.

title: "Who Is Himanta Sarma?" Gaurav Gogoi Takes A Leaf Out Of Father's Political Book
content: Assam Congress chief Gaurav Gogoi has taken a leaf out of his late father's political book to launch a direct charge at Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma ahead of the state assembly elections.

title: US Shouldn't Use Other Countries As Pretext To Acquire Greenland: China
content: China said Monday that the United States shouldn't use other countries as a "pretext" to pursue its interests in Greenland and said that its activities in the Arctic comply with international law.

title: After SIR Notice, Ex Navy Chief Shares More Suggestions For Poll Body
content: Former Indian Navy chief Admiral Arun Prakash (retired) has for a second time in as many days suggested the Election Commission (EC) should tweak the forms used in the special intensive revision (SIR) exercise to capture more information from people.

title: Sabarimala comes under thick security blanket
content: Pilgrims have been asked to view the Makara Jyothi only from designated viewpoints at Pandithavalam, Saramkuthi and the U-turn area and avoid gathering at unsafe hilltop locations

title: School arts festival gold cup gets rousing welcome in Thrissur
content: Trophy procession draws massive public participation.  Public representatives, students, teaching and non-teaching staff, officials of the Education department, PTA members, and local residents joined the march, turning it into a vibrant celebration

title: Kerala actor rape case: court slams survivor‚Äôs counsel for her conduct during trial, lawyer terms it unfortunate
content: Court makes the remarks while considering a contempt of court petition filed by the survivor in the case against former Director General of Police R. Sreelekha

title: Vizhinjam ward election held
content: The ward witnessed 66.97% polling, with 8,912 out of the 13,307 voters casting their votes. If BJP wins, it will secure the simple majority figure of 51 in the 101-ward Corporation. The election also holds strategic importance for the LDF and the UDF, both of which aim to bolster their representation in standing committees.

title: Rubber farmers to be provided assistance for replacing low-yield trees under KERA Project
content: Farmers in six districts will receive financial assistance of ‚Çπ75,000 per hectare for the replanting scheme under the project

title: Mudigere MLA reacts to online comments
content: The Chikkamagaluru police arrested a person who made objectionable comments in September 2025; they have also filed a chargesheet in the case.

title: RJD MP faces backlash over alleged remarks against Yadav voters
content: In a viral video, RJD MP Surendra Yadav is seen abusing members from the Yadav community, saying they did not vote for the party in the recently concluded assembly elections.

title: Environmentalists, seers, legislators oppose river linking project in Sirsi
content: Environmentalists said diverting water from Uttara Kannada to other districts could damage the forests here and also reduce rainfall, defeating the very purpose of diverting surplus water to drier districts of north Karnataka

title: SC asks gangster Abu Salem to justify claim of having spent 25 years in jail
content: According to the extradition terms agreed upon by India and Portugal, Salem cannot be given death penalty and his prison term cannot exceed 25 years

title: Ready for debate on G RAM G, says Shobha Karandlaje
content: The Union Minister describes the new rural job scheme as an effective and pro-people Act, while terming the opposition to it as wrong

title: Congress alleges scam in PM skill scheme, seeks thorough probe
content: Congress leader Kannan Gopinathan claimed that the CAG report has pointed out that 94.53% of beneficiaries' bank accounts turned out to be fake, 96% had fake mobile numbers and 97% had fraud assessor details

title: Four Guinness records reflect Gadkari‚Äôs speed and efficiency, says Naidu
content: Chief Minister credits Union Road Transport Minister‚Äôs close monitoring and NHAI‚Äôs execution for record-setting work on Bengaluru‚ÄìKadapa‚ÄìVijayawada corridor

title: People hit by changes in MGNREGA will force Centre to reverse it: Kharge
content: Attacking the Union government for changing the structure and name of MGNREGA, Kharge says the move was a ‚Äòconspiracy to deprive the rural poor of their right to work and livelihood‚Äô

title: APCID rescues 22 youths trapped in cybercrime compound in Myanmar
content: Cyber criminals lured the youths, promising good jobs in IT sector abroad, and forced them to commit online frauds, say CID officials

title: Protest at Eluru Collectorate against ‚Äòrepressive measures‚Äô on people‚Äôs movements
content: Protesters seek immediate withdrawal of the PD Act imposed on farmers‚Äô leader M. Appalaraju and demand that alleged false cases filed against tribal farmers of Inumuru village be dropped

title: IAS association files criminal complaint over alleged defamatory broadcast against woman officer
content: Broadcast allegedly carried unsubstantiated allegations insinuating a personal relationship between the officer and a political executive, and attempted to link her official postings to such claims

title: SIT informs Speaker‚Äôs office about Mamkootathil‚Äôs arrest details
content: Shamsheer had stated on Sunday that the Assembly Ethics and Privileges Committee will examine the matter. He also said that the Speaker‚Äôs office had sought legal opinion on whether the House could disqualify Mamkootathil under the Anti-Defection Law, given that the Congress had expelled him from the party‚Äôs primary membership, and consequently, the Congress Legislative Party¬†

title: Telangana to file civil petition in Supreme Court on PNLP, takes back writ petition
content: The Minister explained that A.P. was allocated only 484.5 tmc ft water by the Godavari Water Disputes Tribunal but the A.P. had been making continuous efforts to utilise excess water

title: Politics of hatred behind changes to job scheme, claims Gopinath Palaniappan
content: Congress leaders go on a one-day hunger strike in Belagavi against VB-G RAM G Act that has replaced the erstwhile rural job scheme

title: Kunhalikutty cautions LDF against misstepping on Sabarimala
content: The IUML leader said the Congress had no responsibility to answer for the actions of Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil

title: Child trafficking gang busted, three children rescued in Krishna district
content: Three people were arrested on charges of kidnapping the children and selling them away as bonded labourers, say police

title: Magistrate orders production of Mamkootathil in court on Tuesday
content: MLA is a remand prisoner at the Sub Jail in Mavelikkara following his arrest on rape charges from a hotel in Palakkad early on Sunday.¬†Crime Branch has moved the court for his custodial interrogation

title: Medical college doctors to go on indefinite boycott of academic activities from Tuesday
content: Patient-care services in outpatient (OP) clinics in all medical college hospitals also face uncertainty, as doctors propose to intensify the agitation later

title: Cocoa farmers demand price policy and fair market rates
content: They also call for immediate constitution of a State Cocoa Board and establishment of a Central Cocoa Research Centre to address long-standing issues faced by cocoa growers

title: IUML weighs winnability factor against three-term cap ahead of Kerala Assembly polls
content: Senior leaders such as M.K. Muneer, P.K. Kunhalikutty, and Manjalamkuzhi Ali will not be able to contest if the party strictly enforces the cap. At the same time, the party faces mounting pressure to field younger candidates and more women

title: BJP not for sharing of power in Tamil Nadu: Nainar Nagenthran
content: He further said that the venue for Prime Minister Narendra Modi‚Äôs public meeting in the State, scheduled to be held on January 23, was yet to be finalised

title: Never forget your identity, roots, Stalin tells Tamil diaspora
content: Listing steps taken by his government¬†for the welfare of Tamils living abroad, he says the objective is to ensure¬†their welfare regardless of where¬†they live

title: In a first, Kolkata‚Äôs iconic book fair to be connected by Metro Rail
content: Book lovers from all over Kolkata, Howrah and other districts can avail of the Metro to reach the book fair, the biggest event in the city after Durga Puja, with Metro Rail authorities increasing the frequency of the service

title: Who are Raj and Aaditya Thackeray to threaten me?: Annamalai on ‚Äòrasmalai‚Äô jibe
content: BJP leader accuses MNS chief Raj Thackeray and Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray for holding meetings just to ‚Äòinsult and abuse him‚Äô

title: SC extends January 31 deadline by two weeks for completion of Maharashtra local body polls
content: The court refused to entertain any fresh intervention application in the matter, saying those are only intended at delaying the election process and that all such petitions will be listed after the local body polls

title: Supriya Sule interview | ‚ÄòINDIA bloc will hold in 2029 despite temporary recalibrations‚Äô
content: The last two-and-a-half years have been challenging politically for Ajit Pawar and for us, the senior NCP-SP leader said, speaking on a range of issues related to politics in Maharashtra with The Hindu

title: Bhojpuri star Ritesh Pandey quits Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party
content: The announcement was made by Mr. Pandey on social media, citing his inability to carry on with his "work", which earned him "so much love and affection" from the people

title: Congress raises fiscal federalism, inequality concerns ahead of Budget
content: The economy faces structural challenges which cannot be addressed through what it called ‚Äústatistical illusions‚Äù, said Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh

title: Ex-VP Dhankhar admitted to AIIMS after two bouts of unconsciousness
content: He had blacked out on multiple occasions in the past, including in the Rann of Kutch, Uttarakhand, Kerala and the national capital while attending public events as the Vice-President

title: Polavaram‚ÄìNallamala Sagar project will not harm Telangana: Nimmala
content: Water Resources Minister says Andhra Pradesh seeks to use only surplus Godavari waters, urges cooperation between the two Telugu States after Supreme Court proceedings end

title: TCS Q3 profit drops 14% to ‚Çπ10,657 crore
content: Revenue from operations in the quarter under review increased 4.86% to ‚Çπ67,087 crore from ‚Çπ63,973 crore

title: Watch: The village that kept Thyagaraja‚Äôs music alive
content: Every January, the quiet temple town of Thiruvaiyaru, in Tamil Nadu‚Äôs Thanjavur district, comes alive with music. This annual pilgrimage centres on the Thyagaraja temple. It is here that Saint Thyagaraja attained Jeeva Samadhi. Each year, on the day of his samadhi, musicians assemble to render the Saint‚Äôs Pancharatna Kritis in a ritual known as the Thyagaraja Aradhana.

title: Maharashtra State Election Commission bars govt from releasing January instalment for ‚ÄòLadki Bahin‚Äô scheme
content: Maharashtra Congress president Harshwardhan Sapkal has said his party was not opposed to Ladki Bahin scheme, but objected to the release of two months' assistance on the eve of voting, calling it a clear violation of the model code of conduct

title: Opposition UDF slams LDF protest, says no plan to join LDF government in any protest
content: Satheesan says the protest is merely intended to cover up the unholy political alliance between the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and the Bharatiya Janata Party

title: Minister Nehru inaugurates various projects
content: These include the new integrated market complex and several other civic projects, implemented at a total outlay of ‚Çπ8.65 crore.

title: No clear solution for Konthuruthy families; Kochi Corporation to move Kerala High Court for extension of deadline for eviction and rehabilitation
content: 126 families living along the Konthuruthy river puramboke complain that neither the court nor the Corporation has heard their grievances. In an interim order on December 16, 2025, High Court directed eviction, while entrusting the Corporation and the Revenue department to implement rehabilitation measures within four months

title: T.N. government‚Äôs Overseas Manpower Corporation Ltd. inks pact with VIT Chennai
content: The memorandum, pertaining to the mobility of students for education and employment to foreign countries, was signed in the presence of Chief Minister M.K. Stalin.

title: Ahead of T20 World Cup, Supreme Court to examine plea concerning DDCA secretary
content: Former Delhi and District Cricket Association secretary Vinod Tihara has filed an application alleging the incumbent Ashok Sharma has completed his nine-year tenure

title: Ranking the best players in the college football transfer portal
content: the offseason transfer portal window for college football players opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2 . there's no spring transfer period this year, so teams have one big chance to get their rosters right for 2026 . here are ESPN's rankings of the top players in the portal .

title: ‚ÄòDeviation seen in third-stage': Isro‚Äôs PSLV-C62 mission fails ‚Äî here‚Äôs what went wrong
content: the mission encountered an anomaly during end of the PS3 stage . the vehicle is a four stage vehicle with two solid stages and two liquid stages . it comes months after a rare setbac in the space agency's first mission of 2026 .

title: Semifinal takeaways: Utter dominance has become the norm for Indiana
content: Texas, Penn State and Clemson were among the preseason national title favorites . the hoosiers and Hurricanes will play in the CFP national championship on Jan. 19 in the Hard Rock Stadium . they will play for their first title since 2001 .

title: The 10 teams that have gotten off to the hottest portal starts
content: college football's offseason transfer window opened one week ago . a dozen FBS programs have secured commitments from 20 or more players in the portal . there are 10 programs off to impressive starts in building up their rosters for 2026 .

title: WNBA CBA Q&A: Nneka Ogwumike, Napheesa Collier on 'standstill'
content: the WNBA CBA is scheduled to expire at 11:59 p.m. ET on friday . the league and its players union will likely enter into a stage of "status quo" a work stoppage or lockout can be declared without notice . sources say negotiations have netted minimal progress .

title: With no manager, Man United sink to new lows
content: manchester united have seen some low ebbs in the 13 years since Ferguson retired . the 2025-26 campaign will take its place after Brighton ensured any chance of silverware has been extinguished by early January . 12 candidates to replace Ruben Amorim - the inside story of why man united sacked Ruben amorim.

title: CFP National Championship first look: Previewing Miami-Indiana
content: 136 teams hope to taste postseason glory . a champion will be crowned in a matchup . the team will face off at 7:30 p.m. ET on january 19 . it's the first time the team has won the title game in 2025 .

title: NFL wild-card arrivals deliver statement looks
content: wild-card weekend opens the postseason with win-or-go-home stakes . players matched the moment with arrival fits worthy of the stage . a key playoff game in Foxborough, mass., saw a cornerback tapped into Boston sports lore .

title: Raphinha shines as Bar√ßa get thrilling win over Madrid in Supercopa final
content: lvaro Carreras and Ral Asencio spurned great late chances to take the game to a penalty shootout . bar√ßa beat real madrid 3-2 to retain the supercopa de Espaa in sao paulo .

title: Jones won't fight, McGregor will and more 2026 MMA predictions
content: MMA is arguably the most unpredictable sport, because scheduling is based on wins and losses, so no prognostication is too far out . the widespread expectation going into 2026 is that Jones will absolutely make his return to MMA . he will end his short retirement in hopes of fighting at the white house this summer .

title: Josh Allen, Bills outlast Jaguars to advance to AFC divisional round
content: the defense did its job to preserve a 27-24 loss to the Bills . quarterback Josh Allen tipped a Trevor Lawrence pass and safety Cole Bishop came away with the game-ending interception . the ball was in the hands of the team, just as the team would like .

title: Niners defeat defending champs for NFC wild-card win
content: the 49ers won 12 games despite playing most of the season without defensive end and linebacker . they had withstood the repeated injuries to some of their brightest stars . despite that devastating injury to another team leader and captain, they continued to battle .
